Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Psoriasin (S100A7; metallo-AMPs, metal-binding protein, BBII; antimicrobial protein; natural AMPs; humans;  primates, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: keratinocytes, sweat, Skin (e.g. hair follicle), tongueHomo sapiens, including pre-term and term infants
Sequence Information.Structure Description: A structure for a triple mutant has been solved.You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.
Sequence Information.Function: A protein with multiple functions. Initially found to bind Ca2+ (Hoffmann HJ et al., 1994). It has chemotactic activity (Hoffmann HJ et al., 1994).Activity: It is later established as a major AMP from human skin. Active against E. coli. Zn2+ saturated peptide is less active.MOA:bacteria:E. coli: sequstration of zinc can be an important part of skin defense against E. coli. It is found that Sustained Secretion of the Antimicrobial Peptide S100A7 is Dependent on the Downregulation of Caspase-8 (Bhatt et al., 2019).

Literature.Author: Gläser R, Harder J, Lange H, Bartels J, Christophers E, Schröder JM.2005
Literature.Title: Antimicrobial psoriasin (S100A7) protects human skin from Escherichia coli infection.

Sequence Information.Comments: AMP significance: It is down-regulated in acne vulgaris patients (Al-Sudany et al., 2019). Biomarker: Upregulation of psoriasin/S100A7 correlates with clinical severity in patients with oral lichen planus (Stolte et al., 2024).
